info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 8 at 6:02PM MST until July 8 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 700 PM MST.
* At 602 PM MST, a plume of dust was located over southern Tucson, moving southwest at 15 mph.
HAZARD...One to three miles visibility with strong winds in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* Locations impacted include... Tucson, Sahuarita, Green Valley, Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, Casas Adobes, Drexel Heights, Flowing Wells, Tanque Verde, Vail, Corona De Tucson, South Tucson, Three Points, Pascua Pueblo Yaqui Reservation, East Sahuarita, San Xavier Community, Summit, Tucson International Airport, Valencia West, Catalina Foothills and Tucson Mountain Park.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 19 between mile markers 32 and 63. Route 86 between mile markers 157 and 171. Route 77 between mile markers 70 and 74. Interstate 10 between mile markers 252 and 286. Route 83 between mile markers 56 and 58.
info.instruction: Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
